intro: [WRONG START] parablechnum lineatum, commonly known as the narrow-leafed lichen, is a species of lichen that belongs to the family Parmeliaceae. It is characterized by its crustose growth form, forming a thin, tightly adherent layer on rock surfaces. The thallus is typically pale green to yellowish in color, with a smooth or slightly wrinkled surface. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found on bark or stone in temperate regions. This lichen is known for its chemical complexity, producing various secondary metabolites that contribute to its ecological role in nutrient cycling.
